alert.note: Alert for Northampton (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 09 at 2:45AM EDT until April 10 at 7:01AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New Jersey...Pennsylvania... Delaware River At Easton-Phillipsburg affecting Northampton, Hunterdon, and Warren Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Delaware River At Easton-Phillipsburg. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Backwater from the Delaware causes flooding in Easton along the Lehigh River At 20.0 feet, Minor flooding begins upstream in Harmony Station New Jersey and Sandts Eddy Pennsylvania. At 24.0 feet, Larry Holmes Drive in Easton is subject to flooding. Riverside Way in Phillipsburg is flooded in the area of the boat ramp. At 25.0 feet, Portions of Bushkill Drive and Route 611 are flooded due to a combination of Delaware River flooding and backwater effects on Bushkill Creek. At 26.0 feet, Flooding occurs in Easton up to Lehigh Drive. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:30 AM EDT Saturday the stage was 22.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 2:30 AM EDT Saturday was 22.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 25.0 feet this morning. It will then fall below flood stage late this evening. - Flood stage is 22.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 25.2 feet on 08/29/2011. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (2 am) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sun Mon Stg Time Date Delaware River Easton-Phillips 22.0 22.6 Sat 2 am 20.4 18.0 25.0 8am 4/09 &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued by this afternoon at 245 PM EDT.
